text.0: urge us not maghavan to this distressful fight for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength.
text.1: thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar did not men run in crowds together in their fear.
text.2: sing hymns of praise to Śakra lord of power and might laud thou and magnify indra who heareth thee.
text.3: who with his daring might a bull exceeding strong in strength maketh him master of the heaven and earth.
text.4: sing forth to lofty dyaus a strengthbestowing song the bold whose resolute mind hath independent sway.
text.5: high glory hath the asura compact of strength drawn on by two bay steeds a bull a car is he.
text.6: the ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake thou daring of thyself smotest through Śambara.
text.7: when bold with gladdening juice thou warredst with thy bolt sharp and twoedged against the banded sorcerers.
text.8: when with a roar that fills the woods thou forcest down on winds head the stores which Śuṣṇa kept confined.
text.9: who shall have power to stay thee firm and eagersouled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done.
text.10: thou helpest narya turvaśa and yadu and vayyas son turvīti Śatakratu.
text.11: thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nineandninety castles.
text.12: a herolord is he king of a mighty folk who offers free oblations and promotes the law.
text.13: who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.
text.14: his power is matchless matchless is his wisdom chief through their work be some who drink the soma.
text.15: those indra who increase the lordly power the firm heroic strength of thee the giver.
text.16: therefore for thee are these abundant beakers indras drink stonepressed juices held in ladles.
text.17: quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.
text.18: there darkness stood the vault that stayed the waters flow in vṛtras hollow side the raincloud lay concealed.
text.19: but indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed flood following after flood down steep declivities.
text.20: so give us indra blissincreasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people.
text.21: preserve our wealthy patrons save our princes vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.
